original:
Capital supply refers to the provision of financial resources by either the sole owner of a firm or by shareholders in the case of a joint-stock company. 


In free market and laissez-faire forms of capitalism, markets operate with minimal or no regulation over pricing mechanisms. In contrast, mixed economies, which are prevalent today, maintain a dominant market role while incorporating varying degrees of state regulation. This regulat
